etymologies: mid 19th century. From German Murexid from classical Latin mūrex + German -id

definitions: The acid ammonium salt of purpuric acid, a purple-red crystalline solid used in complexometric titrations; 5,5'-nitrilodibarbituric acid ammonium, C₈ H₈ N₆ O₆. Also (more fully "murexide colour"): the characteristic purple-red colour of this salt.
